result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario Edward Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Not to consume any Alcohol.  Not to consume any drugs unless prescribed by physician.

$518-$500 Bond posted=$18 balance due DOC Collect;  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
